page.title: 07KIPPILAW MAINS
page.content: {Kippilaw Mains}farm, once the home farm on the estate of Kippilaw is now divided with two separate owners. {One part}consists of 56 acres all under cultivation__10 acres of peas, grown here for the first time, and 46 acres of barley. Calves are also reared. {The other part,}including all the farm buildings, consists of 180 acres owned and farmed by an Insurance Company. Wheat, barley and oil seed rape are grown, also some grazing for sheep. { {Fort Rowchester, Kippilaw Mains.}this is the site of a fortified camp. All that remains is the west sector of the ditch about 120 metres in length, along the arc south west of the farm and in the plantation that adjoins the paddock. It is known as "Camp Field" and must never be ploughed.
